html:
Etymology 1[edit]

From bene (“well”) +‎ dīcō (“speak”).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /be.neˈdiː.koː/, [bɛ.n̪ɛˈd̪iː.koː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /be.neˈdi.ko/, [bɛ.nɛˈd̪iː.kɔ]

Verb[edit]

benedīcō (present infinitive benedīcere, perfect active benedīxī, supine benedictum); third conjugation, irregular short imperative

  1. I speak well of someone, commend.
  2. (Late Latin, Ecclesiastical Latin) I bless, praise.
    Benedicite, omnia opera Domini [1]
    All ye works of the Lord, praise ye the Lord
Usage notes[edit]

This is used as a compound only outside of Classical Latin.

Antonyms[edit]
  • maledīcō
Descendants[edit]
  • Corsican: benedì
  • Extremaduran: bendizir
  • Franco-Provençal: benêtre, benir
  • Italian: benedire
  • Old French: beneistre, beneïstre, beneir, beneïr
    • French: bénir
    • Norman: béni (Jersey)
  • Navarro-Aragonese:
    • Aragonese: bendicir
  • Old Leonese:
    • Asturian: bendicir
  • Old Occitan:
    • Catalan: beneir
    • Occitan: benesir
  • Old Portuguese: bẽeizer, bẽezer
    • Galician: beicer
    • Portuguese: benzer
  • Old Spanish:
    • Spanish: bendecir
      • → Galician: bendicir
  • Rhaeto-Romance:
    • Friulian: benedî, binidî
    • Romansch: benedir, banadir, banadeir
  • Sardinian: benedíxi, benedíxiri, beneíchere, beníchere
  • Venetian: benedir
  • → Albanian: bekoj
  • → English: benedict
  • → Middle High German: benedīen, benedīgende
    • German: benedeien
  • → Old Irish: bennachaid, bendachaid
    • Middle Irish: bennaigid
      • Irish: beannaigh
      • Manx: bannee
  • → Portuguese: bendizer
  • → Welsh: bendithio, benditho, bendigo

Etymology 2[edit]

Inflected form of benedicus.

Adjective[edit]

benedicō

  1. dative masculine singular of benedicus
  2. dative neuter singular of benedicus
  3. ablative masculine singular of benedicus
  4. ablative neuter singular of benedicus

References[edit]

  • benedico in Charlton T. Lewis and Charles Short (1879) A Latin Dictionary, Oxford: Clarendon Press
  • benedico in Gaffiot, Félix (1934) Dictionnaire Illustré Latin-Français, Hachette
  • benedico in Ramminger, Johann (accessed 16 July 2016) Neulateinische Wortliste: Ein Wörterbuch des Lateinischen von Petrarca bis 1700‎[2], pre-publication website, 2005-2016
